snippet.description:
To launch their new wave of commercials aimed at increasing international brand awareness, well known and loved Polish beer company Tyskie came to Rushes to help complete the visual effects needed to supplement their beautifully shot commercials.

Early briefings gave directions towards a subtle style with all emphasis on VFX playing a supplementary role to the edit. Tasked with creating the matte paintings to serve as backdrops to the piece, lead designer Barry Corcoran researched Russian mountainous regions for reference before going to photoshop to digitally create his landscapes.

To streamline the workflow, Barry maintained a close working relationship with the clients, supplying varying versions of the separate landscapes until the client was satisfied the right look for the piece was achieved and the brief was completed. Each matte painting was seamlessly digitally composited into the scenes using Nuke and Flame to give an all round slightly exaggerated feel to the project.

On finishing the project, Barry maintains ,"the main challenges of the piece was achieving the right sense of balance with the matte paintings and the principal photography, so as to not take away from the piece, but to add to it".

Upon the completion of the project, all matte paintings and sky replacement serve to enhance the narrative whilst maintaining a strict sense of realism.
snippet.title: Tyskie Beer
